intro: Oreinotinus ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty orchid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive rust-colored petals and sepals, which give it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Oreinotinus ferrugineus has a sympodial growth habit, with each stem producing a series of leaves and flowers along its length. It is known for its delicate, fragrant blooms that appear in late spring or early summer.
